sen.j: 慧聡（えそう、生没年不詳）は、飛鳥時代に百済から渡来した僧。
sen.e: Eso (date of birth and death unknown) was a Buddhist priest who came from Baekje in the Aska period.

sen.j: 推古天皇3年（ユリウス暦595年）に渡来して仏教を広めた。
sen.e: In 595, he came to Japan to spread Buddhism.

sen.j: 推古天皇4年（596年）に法興寺（蘇我善德が寺司、現在の飛鳥寺安居院）が完成すると、高句麗から渡来した恵慈と住し、ともに三宝の棟梁と称された。
sen.e: When Hoko-ji Temple (SOGA no Zentoku being then the chief priest and now known as Asuka-dera Temple Ango-in) was built, Eso lived there with Eji who came from Goguryeo and was addressed as the leader of Three Treasures of Buddhism.

sen.j: 『三國佛法傳通縁起』によれば、三論宗（南都六宗の一つ）の学僧で厩戸皇子の仏教の師となったという。
sen.e: According to "Sangoku Buppo Denzu Engi", Eso was a scholar as well as a priest of the Sanron Sect (one of the Nanto Rokushu) and began teaching Buddhism to Prince Umayado.
